result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel L Villegas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angel L Villegas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angel L Villegas was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Angel L Villegas was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges, including the Domestic Abuse surcharge, of this case, except any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, David O. or 2037 W Forest Home Ave. UNLESS the parties requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.  rmm
At the request of the agent, the 8/21/15 probation review is rescheduled to 10/23/15 at 1:30 pm.  rmm

Defendant Angel L Villegas in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Angel L Villegas in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 112 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, David O. or 2037 W Forest Home Ave. UNLESS the parties requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges, including the Domestic Abuse surcharge, of this case, except any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angel L Villegas in court.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for sentencing hearing. Attorney Rupich did not appear. Courted ordered case adjourned for a new sentencing date in Branch 40.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angel L Villegas in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Angel L Villegas in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed. As to Counts 2 and 3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court REMANDED the Defendant into the Custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Angel L Villegas not in court, in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Jury Trial. Parties ready to proceed. Case passed.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Angel L Villegas not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/27/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Angel L Villegas not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case remains set for final pretrial on 4/07/15 at 1:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick James Rupich in court, defendant Angel L Villegas not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail hearing waived.  Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angel L Villegas in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Defendant Angel L Villegas in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Ronald Campos.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dawn S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Angel L Villegas in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  
Defendant Angel L Villegas in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Counts ( 2 and 3). 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
